title: Cadets Pitch Shutout
text:
Talk about it in PREPS & PRIVATES SPORTS 
Benedictine started slow in their State championship rematch with Bishop Ireton but they outscored the Cardinals 49-0 over the last three quarters to remain unbeaten. Duke University commit Scott Bracey threw two touchdown passes while running in another and quarterback Jake Waldrop tossed two touchdown passes for the Cadets who finished with 377 yards of total offense. 
After a scoreless 1st quarter, Bishop Ireton appeared on their way to the games first score until Tyren Cloyd recovered a bad snap at the Benedictine 25-yard line. Bracey led Benedictine on a 75-yard drive and scored on a 1-yard quarterback sneak for a 7-0 lead. 
The Cadets made it 20-0 after another turnover by Bishop Ireton led to a 24-yard touchdown pass from Bracey to Anthony Roberson with 2:28 to go before halftime. Bracey finished 5 of 7 passing for 98 yards. He connected with Vanderbilt commit Donaven Tennyson across the middle for a 26-yard touchdown strike with 6:32 to go in the 3rd quarter. 
Benedictine added two defensive touchdowns in the 3rd quarter. Old Dominion commit Parrish Gordon picked up a fumble and returned it 82-yards to give the Cadets a 34-0 lead. Two plays later, senior Graham Flinn, who made an interception in the State championship game, picked off a pass an returned it to the Cardinals 14-yard line. Sylvester Mayers powered in from 1-yard out to start the running clock. 
The Cadets extended the lead on their 1st possession in the 3rd quarter when Waldrop threw his second touchdown pass finding Roberson for a 7-yard score. Waldrop had connected with Justin Smith earlier in the game FEATURED PRODUCT
